Comments_List: In this class, I have learned research methods and developed the result in analysis on paper on tissue engineering and biomaterials. The class is design in a way that the first parts of the class cover basic foundation topics regarding immunology and biomaterials and the second parts of the class focus on learning issue/ disease and current researches on that topic. I think having this type of style is very helpful for us to prepare us to properly conduct research and effectively analyze research papers. And most of the class is focus on developing these important research skills.
The basic knowledge about foreign body response to biomaterials, immune response, and wound healing process.
Learned how to really read a scientific paper and question the methods.

Strength
Organized: Introduction in the beginning and research application at the end of the course
Research analysis focus / most of the class

Weakness/Suggestions 
Maybe inviting guest speakers that are in the industry or in the clinic may give additional perspectives of for students interested in going into industry of clinics.

Strengths: the instructor gave undergraduates and graduates different assignments, which is more suitable for students. 

Weaknesses: seems a little easy for graduates, making them less engaged in the class. Maybe also giving graduates some exams will help.
I would recommend the course for students who want to have a good foundation in tissue engineering and biomaterials particularly to have a strong research paper analysis in these areas.
Yes, I think for students who are interested in biomaterials and want to enlarge their views on bioengineering, it would be a good class.
Yes! Every materials and tissue engineer should take it.
